column1: Capannori (Italian pronunciation: [kaˈpannori]) is an Italian town and comune in the province of Lucca
The 40 hamlets of Capannori are located on the lands that once corresponded to the eastern territories of the Republic of Lucca. Most of those hamlets date back to medieval times.
Colognora di Compito was featured in the 2008 film Miracle at St. Anna.
Located in south of its province
column2: next to the provinces of Pisa and Pistoia

column1: The most populated village is not the town of Capannori
The hamlets of Capannori are: Badia di Cantignano
column5: Colle di Compito (de:Colle di Compito; the site of prisoner-of-war camp PG 60 during World War II)

column1: The area is characterized by the number of distinctive towers (once used to communicate). Main sights include:
